Dear Mr. Jones:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Barbara A Cote, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff.
Section The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency’s program statement and to provide for
the continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 11/13/23, a youth held the arms of another youth while a third
youth put their hand over the youth's mouth and nose to prevent
him from breathing. A staff member was present and did not
intervene.
Investigation Complainant was interviewed via telephone on November 14,
2023, and reported they had no further information.
Assistant Facility Administrator (AFA) was interviewed face
to face at the facility on November 16, 2023, in collaboration
with DHHS Worker. AFA stated she was made aware of the
incident the day after it occurred by Therapist. AFA reported
Youth A told Therapist and Therapist told AFA what happened.
AFA described watching the video and reported Staff 1 never
stood up to intervene and stop Youth B and Youth D. AFA
reported Youth B and Youth D were known to mess around with
the younger youth and Staff 1 should have stood up and
intervened in their behavior. AFA stated Staff 1 did not handle the
situation appropriately and should have done more to stop Youth
B and Youth D. AFA reported Staff 1 has been trained on how to
redirect and intervene when youth are acting this way and Staff 1
will be retrained.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on
November 16, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker.
2

Youth A reported the facility being “scary” and stated a couple of
days ago Youth B and Youth D tried to suffocate Youth A while
they were in the dayroom. Youth A described sitting in a chair
across from Staff 1, talking to Staff 1 as she was working on
diamond art when Youth B and Youth D came up behind Youth A.
Youth A reported Youth D plugged Youth A’s nose and covered
Youth A’s mouth so he could not breath. Youth A stated Youth B
held Youth A’s arms down on the chair so Youth A could not
move. Youth A stated Staff 1 sat in a chair across the table from
where the incident was taking place and told Youth B and Youth D
to stop. Youth A reported Staff 1 never did anything else to stop
Youth B and Youth D, only told them to “stop.” Youth A described
Youth D having his hand over Youth A’s nose and mouth for
maybe one minute. Youth A stated, “it hurt so much to breath,
and I couldn’t get air.” Youth A reported Staff 1 should have done
something else to stop Youth B and Youth D.
Youth A also stated Youth D picked Youth A up off the floor and
threw Youth A to the ground. Youth A reported Staff 1 did not say
or do anything when this happened. Youth A stated Staff 1 was
working but he believed Staff 1 was in the hallway when he was
thrown to the ground. Youth A reported this was the first time Staff
1 worked on the pod since being at the facility.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on
November 16, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker.
Youth B described “goofing around” when he held Youth A’s arms
down on the chair and Youth D covered Youth A’s nose and
mouth with Youth D’s hands. Youth B described Staff 1 sitting
across the table when Youth B and Youth D were “screwing
around” with Youth A. Youth B denied trying to hurt Youth A.
Youth B stated Youth B and Youth D were just “horseplaying.”
Youth B stated Staff 1 told Youth B and Youth D to stop so they
stopped. Youth B reported holding Youth A’s arms down on the
chair for a few seconds. Youth B stated youth are not supposed
to play around like that, but all the youth were “joking.”
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on
November 16, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker.
Youth C described an incident at the facility where Youth D was
“rough” with Youth A. Youth C stated Youth D plugged Youth A’s
nose and covered his mouth. Youth C reported Youth A was just
sitting in a chair at a table, not doing anything. Youth C described
Staff 1 sitting across from Youth A and telling Youth D to “get off”
Youth A. Youth C stated, “Youth D should not have been doing
that, he’s an asshole.” Youth C reported staff will tell youth to stop
3

if they are acting out or behaving like Youth D. Youth C stated if
youth continue to keep doing something they are not supposed to
do staff will get between the youth to break it up. Youth C
reported Staff 1 only told Youth D to stop, Staff 1 never stood up
from the table or did anything else to intervene. Youth C stated
Youth D stopped and walked away from Youth A. Youth C did not
report seeing other youth on the unit do anything else to Youth A.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
November 16, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff
1 stated she was in the day room sitting at a table working on
diamond art when she looked up and Youth D had his hands over
Youth A’s nose and mouth. Staff 1 reported Youth B walked over
and held Youth A’s hands down on the chair Youth A was sitting
in. Staff 1 stated she told Youth B and Youth D to stop, and after
telling them a second time Youth B and Youth D stopped and
walked away from Youth A. Staff 1 stated the incident lasted only
a few seconds. Staff 1 reported Youth B and Youth D were
constantly “horseplaying.” Staff 1 described Youth B and Youth D
making sexual comments, Youth B licking Youth D’s feet, playfully
throwing things at each other, and laughing. Staff 1 stated she
was not sure how to handle the situation and denied being trained
on the procedures. Staff 1 reported the only thing she knew how
to do was to verbally redirect Youth B and Youth D’s behavior.
Staff 1 reported she was the only staff member working on the
unit. Staff 1 denied seeing Youth D pick up and throw Youth A to
the ground while being in the day room.
Therapist was interviewed face to face at the facility on
November 16, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker.
Therapist reported Youth A requested to talk with her the day after
the incident with Youth B and Youth D. Therapist stated Youth A
told Therapist he was afraid of the older youth in the facility.
Therapist described Youth A having a core group of staff
members he feels comfortable talking with and letting know if he
feels scared. Therapist stated she feels Youth A’s needs are
being met at the facility.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of November 13, 2023, was reviewed on November
16, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. The video shows
Staff 1 sitting in a chair at a table facing all the youth in the pod.
At no time is Staff 1 observed to move from the seated position.
Video shows Youth B and Youth D throwing items at one another,
pushing each other, laughing, jumping off a chair, throwing a box
of playing cards, and Youth B licks Youth D’s foot. Youth D is
4

observed picking Youth A off the ground and throwing Youth A to
the floor. This occurs directly in front of Staff 1. Approximately
seven minutes later, Youth A is observed sitting in a chair across
the table from Staff 1, who is still seated at the table. Youth D
approaches Youth A and places an empty bag that Jenga pieces
were in over Youth A’s face. Youth D removes the bag from
Youth A’s face and takes one of his hands and pinches Youth A’s
nose closed and uses his other hand to cover Youth A’s mouth.
Video then shows Youth B walk over to Youth A and hold Youth
A’s arms down on the chair. This exchange lasts approximately
21 seconds before Youth B and Youth D remove their hands from
Youth A. Youth B and Youth D walk away from Youth A and sit
down in chairs next to one another. Youth D is observed quickly
covering Youth B’s nose and mouth with his hands. Youth B is
seen laughing. There is no sound on the video. Staff 1 is
observed sitting doing diamond art during these incidents.
Documents Reviewed:
• Staff 1’s personnel file: There was one disciplinary record
dated 10/30/2023, not related supervision of youth. Staff 1
completed Orientation/New Hire Training, including Active
Supervision of Youth and Child Management Techniques
on October 16, 2023.
• Incident Report dated 11/14/2023: Incident report
documents Staff 1 “went to walk around the table” and
Youth B and Youth D let go of the other peer. This is not
consistent with what the video shows.
• Osceola Youth Center Policy, Standards of Conduct:
Includes the expectation staff are to interact with youth in a
manner promoting their emotional and physical safety.
• DHHS Worker interviewed Youth D face to face at Youth
D’s residence on November 29, 2023. DHHS Worker’s
notes from the interview are:
“[Youth D] reported he did get in trouble prior to leaving the
facility. [Youth D] reported he was just joking around but
[Youth A] told staff he was trying to hurt him. [Youth D] told
the [DHHS Worker] he was referring to the incident with
[Youth A]. [Youth D] was asked to walk the worker through
what happened with him and [Youth A]. [Youth D] stated he
was just "joking" around on the unit with another youth
[Youth B]. He reported they were seeing how long they
could hold their breath. He reported [Youth A] was sitting
down at the table. [Staff 1] was sitting right in front of them.
He walked up to [Youth A] and plugged his nose and
covered his mouth. He stated [Youth B] walked over and
was holding his arms. [Staff 1] told them to stop so they did.
5

He reported [Youth A] was breathing heavy but also
laughing after it. [Staff 1] just told them once and they
stopped. If he had to put a time frame on it, he would say
maybe 10 seconds that he covered [Youth A’s] airways. He
stated he was not trying to harm [Youth A] at all. They were
just "goofing" around. He was asked if he did anything else
to [Youth A]. He reported he did pick him up off the ground.
He wasn't trying to hurt him. [Youth D] reported they were
just bored and messing around. He did not try to harm
[Youth A] at all. He reported he put [Youth A] back on the
ground safely. [Youth D] was asked if other staff allowed
him and [Youth B] to act that way. [Youth D] kind of
laughed and stated, "not at all". [Youth D] gave an example
that if [Staff 2] was working he would have stopped them
well before any of that happened. He reported none of the
other staff that generally work on the unit allow that kind of
behavior. He reported [Staff 1] was just sitting there and not
really doing anything so they just had a fun time. He
reported the other staff are strict, but they are nice. He had
no concerns regarding any of the staff at the facility. He felt
safe at the facility. He reported he liked the facility
compared to other places.”
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance as Staff 1 did not intervene
to stop Youth B and Youth D from holding Youth A down in a chair
and covering Youth A’s nose and mouth. Staff 1 sat in a chair
doing diamond art, across the table from Youth A during the
incident, only verbally redirecting Youth B and Youth D. Not only
did Staff 1 not follow the facility’s policy of promoting youths’
physical safety, but she also allowed a situation that was unsafe
creating an environment where Youth A felt scared and afraid.
Additionally, Staff 1 was observed sitting in a chair when Youth D
picked up Youth A and threw Youth A to the floor.
Conclusion Violation Established
6

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
